wikipedia_page.main: Lady Evelyn Leonora Almina Beauchamp ( BEE-chəm; née Herbert; 15 August 1901 – 31 January 1980) was the daughter of George Herbert, 5th Earl of Carnarvon. In November 1922, she, her father and the archaeologist Howard Carter were the first people in modern times to enter the tomb of the Egyptian Pharaoh Tutankhamun. She later married Sir Brograve Beauchamp and had a daughter. Lady Evelyn died in 1980, at the age of 78.

response: The 6th Earl had a younger sister, who became Lady Evelyn Beauchamp.
* Lady Evelyn Beauchamp, one of the first people in modern times to enter the tomb of Tutenkhamun
* November 4 - Howard Carter discovers Tutankhamun's tomb. He opens it in the presence of George Herbert, 5th Earl of Carnarvon and Herbert's daughter, Evelyn Beauchamp, on November 26.
*Evelyn Beauchamp,  (1901–1980), daughter of 5th Earl of Carnarvon and one of the first in people in modern times to enter Tutankhamun's tomb
* Evelyn Beauchamp (née Herbert), one of the first people to enter the tomb of the Tutankhamun

response: On 8 October 1923, Beauchamp married Lady Evelyn Leonora Almina Herbert, daughter of the 5th Earl of Carnarvon at St Margaret's Church, Westminster.Illustrated London News, Saturday 13 October 1923, page 6. They had one child, Patricia Evelyn Beauchamp (born 11 July 1925, died 7 October 2014). Sir Brograve and Lady Evelyn are buried beside each other in Putney Vale Cemetery in South West London.Putney Vale Cemetery: Burial and cremation records
